instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board works with battery only , !!!
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board work on battery only, does work with power adapter.but green light is on .. i changed the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> still no result, also i notice pic 2 on isl chip votahe is not constant its moving between 15.5---16.6  , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> around 1.5v only

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board works with battery only , !!!
threads.message:
Check sense resistors first, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> and traces as always, check ACIN and voltage on <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> booth pins..

Do you have 12.6V stable???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board works with battery only , !!!
threads.message: no 12.6v, only 1.5v.... ppbus g3 h missing

i think we have a dupe thread. doh. I moved your post to a new thread before I saw this one. 

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is blown, check it!
